TopicTitle: CKAN (The Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network); v1.28.0 - Dyson

Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Voidi said:

Is there a option to select the KSP instance at Startup (via a commandline parameter) ?

There's supposed to be, but it's not working currently. Fix in progress here: https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/pull/2449

Quick question: I'm looking at a mod that doesn't show up on my compatible list (because I've set the filter to show all). I'm running 1.4.2 and the mod is for 1.3.1. It's the Coyote Freighter mod. If CKAN doesn't say it's compatible, is it really incompatible, or is CKAN just comparing numbers?

18 minutes ago, Bakkerbaard said:

Quick question: I'm looking at a mod that doesn't show up on my compatible list (because I've set the filter to show all). I'm running 1.4.2 and the mod is for 1.3.1. It's the Coyote Freighter mod. If CKAN doesn't say it's compatible, is it really incompatible, or is CKAN just comparing numbers?

In the case of that mod, CKAN is going by the version the author selected on SpaceDock:
Sorry if this is off topic, but how did you design the CKAN logo? (This one: ) I have not found any fonts like the KSP logo font that you used there.

52 minutes ago, TeslaPenguin1 said:

Sorry if this is off topic, but how did you design the CKAN logo? (This one: ) I have not found any fonts like the KSP logo font that you used there. 

You'd have to ask @Felger, apparently it was his work:

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/240

His comments there say it was done with GIMP, so I would guess it's a free font that comes with Linux.
It looks a lot like Liberation Sans to me.

A problem with downloading the Kerbalism mod (v1.6.0) has been reported and I am experiencing the same problem myself with downloading via CKAN. The mod's author has stated to contact CKAN to report the problem.

Here's a copy of the reported problems symptoms...

================================================================================

Hi all,

In first , Thanks for your job!!

I have  problem when i try to do the update by Ckan. i don t understand the error so i don t know if It s the mod , my other mod or my configuration who do that. And i don t know if i must contact you or Ckan.

The error:

"CKAN.InvalidModuleFileKraken: Kerbalism 1.6.0: C:\Users\Mephistos\AppData\Local\Temp\tmp5CDF.tmp has length 3789554, should be 3786341
   à CKAN.NetModuleCache.Store(CkanModule module, String path, String description, Boolean move)
   à CKAN.NetAsyncModulesDownloader.ModuleDownloadsComplete(NetModuleCache cache, Uri[] urls, String[] filenames, Exception[] errors)"

 

it s for update 1.5.1 to 1.6.0 on Ckan 1.25.1 for ksp 1.4.3.2152

 

Thanks for your help

================================================================================

Please help! Ican no longer download the Kerbalism mod via CKAN. Any help would be appreciated. I'm hoping it's simple and I won't have to resort to installing the mod manually. I really like using CKAN to manage my mods in use.

56 minutes ago, GJNelson said:

Please help!

Should be OK now if you click Refresh.

24 minutes ago, GJNelson said:

I'm still getting this error message...

You need to click Refresh if you haven't already, to fetch the fix onto your system.

I'm having the same problem as @GJNelson . I have the exact same error messages when trying to install kerbalism. Oddly enough, CKAN was on version 1.24 and would not update itself. When I got the error it would crash. I checked versions and found 1.25 available. I replaced my CKAN with the new one. Same error comes up but, this time instead of crashing it locks up entirely forcing me to task manager kill it. Clicking "refresh" as @HebaruSan suggests has absolutely no effect. I can install this mod manually but I really hate to handle my own updates when I start getting mod crazy, which is the reason I use CKAN to begin with.

Could this be kerbalism even if I can install manually? I have installed other mods today with CKAN and discovered this problem when installing KAS, KIS, and kerbalism (and dependencies). After the error, I installed the dependencies first then KAS, then KIS, and finally Kerbalism which threw the error. It is the only mod I have found that has the problem. I'd be happy to provide any information required.

54 minutes ago, AngrybobH said:

I have the exact same error messages when trying to install kerbalism.

Oh right, the bot reverted that fix because it still has the original versions of the download in its cache. Sorry, I forgot about that.

We can work around that by indexing it from GitHub instead of SpaceDock. I made that change just now; try clicking Refresh again.

13 hours ago, HebaruSan said:

Oh right, the bot reverted that fix because it still has the original versions of the download in its cache. Sorry, I forgot about that.

We can work around that by indexing it from GitHub instead of SpaceDock. I made that change just now; try clicking Refresh again.

Thank you, sir. This has fixed it.

Oh right, the bot reverted that fix because it still has the original versions of the download in its cache. Sorry, I forgot about that.

We can work around that by indexing it from GitHub instead of SpaceDock. I made that change just now; try clicking Refresh again.

Yep, works for me too, thanks!

Hello! I'm having difficulties while trying to install several mods with CKAN. I had previously used CKAN to install 48 different mods with no errors. It seems that the mods i were attempting to install succeed to install, but I knew i should bring this to your attention so that you may resolve the problem.  Below you will find a screenshot of the error message and a spoiler with the full text of the details.

Thank you for your time, I apologize if this has been handled already but, its's better to be safe with these kinds of things.

27 minutes ago, ThaZeus said:

Thank you for your time, I apologize if this has been handled already but, its's better to be safe with these kinds of things.

Thanks for the report. I believe we're tracking this issue here: https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/issues/2342

Unfortunately it's one of those investigation-heavy problems that are hard to solve if it's not happening to you, and none of the developers are affected so far.  Further details and a possible workaround are discussed at that link.

I have an idea for a new feature: Would it be possible to allow users to override it's controls forcing you to only install compatible mods? Many mods don't update their mod data to add compatibility to new patch releases of the game, so there are many mods which work perfectly well in 1.4.3 but can't be installed through CKAN because they only officially support up to 1.4.2/1.4.1/1.4.0. I understand not letting users install without some sort of override because of incompatibility issues, but this would make it more useful for installing mods.

6 minutes ago, ASCIInerd73 said:

I have an idea for a new feature: Would it be possible to allow users to override it's controls forcing you to only install compatible mods? Many mods don't update their mod data to add compatibility to new patch releases of the game, so there are many mods which work perfectly well in 1.4.3 but can't be installed through CKAN because they only officially support up to 1.4.2/1.4.1/1.4.0. I understand not letting users install without some sort of override because of incompatibility issues, but this would make it more useful for installing mods.

That's an idea for an old feature.

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide#choosing-compatible-game-versions

The usual disclaimer applies: Please do not complain to mod authors about problems encountered when installing their mods on versions they don't officially support.

Texture replacer metadata issue:

SpaceDock shows TextureReplacer Version 3.1 for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 listed in CKAN.

But CKAN itself shows only version 2.7

Edited June 1, 2018 by SVlad

Texture replacer metadata issue:

SpaceDock shows TextureReplacer Version 3.1 for Kerbal Space Program 1.4.3 listed in CKAN.

But CKAN itself shows only version 2.7

Thanks for the FYI; continued in that mod's forum thread.

KSP Interstellar Extended has been on 1.19.2 for a couple weeks(?) now, and CKAN still only shows 1.19.1.1 ... this mod typically has not had issues with CKAN metadata in the past, any idea what's going on?

2 minutes ago, ss8913 said:

KSP Interstellar Extended has been on 1.19.2 for a couple weeks(?) now, and CKAN still only shows 1.19.1.1 ... this mod typically has not had issues with CKAN metadata in the past, any idea what's going on?

That version was indexed as 1.9.2 because that's what the author entered on SpaceDock:

Newbie here,

The mod I wan't isn't showing up, but I have been told it's there. Is there something more to installing CKAN than putting all the files in a folder?

56 minutes ago, sle_epy said:

The mod I wan't isn't showing up, but I have been told it's there. Is there something more to installing CKAN than putting all the files in a folder?

There's an "Installing the client" section on the user guide that may help:

https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/User-guide

On 6/6/2018 at 1:05 AM, HebaruSan said:

There's an "Installing the client" section on the user guide that may help:
